document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick, 1911 (Lepidoptera Lecithoceridae) from China, with descriptions of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick, 1911 (Lepidoptera Lecithoceridae) from China, with descriptions of seven new species

bibRefCitation.refString: Park, K. T. (2005) Two new species of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae) from China and Vietnam. Journal of Asia-Pacific Entomology, 8, 123 - 125. https: // doi. org / 10.1016 / S 1226 - 8615 (08) 60081 - 3

Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 15 ) wingspan 16.0–22.0 mm. In the male genitalia this species is characterized by the valva subparallel and the juxta with lateral process shorter than 1/6 the length of the juxta ( Fig. 28 ), and in the female genitalia by the large single signum with four horizontal ridges ( Fig. 36 ). It is superficially similar to
N. grandiunca
sp. nov.
, and the differences are stated in the preceding species.
Distribution. China ( Chongqing , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hubei , Sichuan , Zhejiang ), Vietnam (North).
